Key Match Events: Randal Kolo Muani fired Les Bleus in front in the first half
Ousmane Dembele curled home superbly on 54 minutes
Dembele thundered in a blistering second goal for Les Bleus 12 minutes after the interval
Mbappe looked to make up for lost time upon his introduction, going close on three occasions
Post-Match Reflections: Didier Deschamps’ side ultimately made their fortune count, though, and an accomplished second-half display was capped off by Dembele’s excellent solo strike, as France bounced back from their defeat to Italy last time out
Player of the match: N’Golo Kante (France)
Miscellaneous Highlights: France opened the scoring in the 30th minute with their first real chance
A strong start to the second half paved the way for France to double their advantage
Belgium started well, yet once France opened the scoring, Domenico Tedesco’s team looked remarkably short of ideas
Others: Kante was instrumental to France gaining a measure of control in the first half
The post came to France’s rescue early on when Dodi Lukebakio ghosted into the six-yard box unmarked
Lois Openda tucking into a gaping net had Lukebakio shown more composure when put through by Kevin De Bruyne soon after
